response: The relevant Excel function that joins several text strings into one text string is CONCATENATE. In newer versions of Excel, you can also use the CONCAT function.
The relevant Excel function that returns a specified number of characters from the beginning of a text string is LEFT.
The relevant Excel function that returns the number of characters in a text string is LEN().
The relevant Excel function that returns a specified number of characters from a text string, starting at a specified position is the MID function.
The relevant Excel function that capitalizes the first letter of each word in a text string and converts all other letters to lowercase is the PROPER function.
The relevant Excel function that replaces part of a text string with a different text string is the REPLACE function.
The relevant Excel function that returns a specified number of characters from the end of a text string is the RIGHT function.
The relevant Excel function that removes all extra spaces from a text string except for single spaces between words is the TRIM function.
The relevant Excel function for returning the serial number of the date that is a specified number of months before or after the start date is EDATE.
The relevant Excel function for returning the serial number of the last day of the month before or after a specified number of months is EOMONTH.
The relevant Excel function that returns the number of whole working days between two dates is NETWORKDAYS.
The relevant Excel function to return the week number in a year is WEEKNUM().
The relevant Excel function that returns the serial number of the date before or after a specified number of workdays is WORKDAY.

The relevant Excel function that returns the number of years and fraction of years between two specified dates is the DATEDIF function with the "Y" unit, or more specifically, to get the fraction of years, you can use the YEARFRAC function.
The relevant Excel function for extracting data stored in a PivotTable is the GETPIVOTDATA function.
The relevant Excel function for looking for a value in the top row of a table or array of values and returning the value in the same column from a row you specify is the HLOOKUP function.
The relevant Excel function that returns the value or reference to the value of the specified row and column of a table or range is the INDEX function.
The relevant Excel function that returns the reference specified by a text string is INDIRECT.
The relevant Excel function that returns the relative position of an item in a range of contiguous cells in a row or a column that matches a specified value is the MATCH function.
The relevant Excel function that returns the reference to a single cell or a range of cells that is a specified number of rows and columns from a cell or range of cells is the OFFSET function.
The relevant Excel function that converts a vertical range of cells to a horizontal range, or vice versa, is the TRANSPOSE function.
The relevant Excel function that returns TRUE if the value is text is ISTEXT.
The relevant Excel function that returns the absolute value of a number is ABS.
The relevant Excel function that rounds a number up to the nearest multiple of significance is CEILING.
The relevant Excel function that returns the possible number of combinations for a given number of items is COMBIN.
The relevant Excel function that returns a number rounded to the nearest even integer away from zero is the EVEN function.
The relevant Excel function to return e raised to a power is EXP(). For example, EXP(1) returns e raised to the power of 1.
The relevant Excel function that returns the factorial of a number is FACT.
The relevant Excel function that returns a number rounded towards zero to the nearest multiple of a specified number is the "ROUNDDOWN" function.
The relevant Excel function to round a number down to the nearest integer is FLOOR. Alternatively, the ROUNDDOWN function can also be used to round a number down to the nearest integer.
The relevant Excel function that returns the natural logarithm of a number is LN().
The relevant Excel function that returns the logarithm of a number to the base specified is LOG(number, base).
The relevant Excel function that returns the remainder after a number is divided by a specified divisor is the MOD function.
The relevant Excel function for returning a number rounded up or down to the nearest multiple of a specified number is the MROUND function.
The relevant Excel function that returns a number rounded to the nearest odd integer away from zero is ODD.
The relevant Excel function that returns the value of pi is PI().
The Excel function that returns the result of a number raised to a specified power is the POWER function. For example, POWER(number, power).

The relevant Excel function that returns a random draw from a uniform distribution between two specified numbers is RANDARRAY (in newer Excel versions) or you can use a formula based on RAND(), for example, =RAND()*(b-a)+a where 'a' and 'b' are the lower and upper bounds respectively.
The relevant Excel function to return the accrued interest for a security that pays periodic interest is ACCRINT.
The relevant Excel function that returns the depreciation of an asset for a specified period using the fixed-declining balance method is the "DB" function.

The relevant Excel function to convert the dollar price expressed as a fraction into a dollar price expressed as a decimal number is the function PRICE(). However, the more direct and commonly used function for fractions to decimals in Excel is the function called DECIMAL(). The DECIMAL() function converts a text representation of a fractional number to a decimal number.
The relevant Excel function for returning the effective annual interest rate given the nominal annual interest rate and the number of compounding periods per year is the EFFECT function.
The relevant Excel function that returns the future value of a constant annuity is the FV function.
The relevant Excel function that returns the interest payment for a specified period of an annuity is the IPMT function.
The relevant Excel function to calculate the internal rate of return for a series of cash flows that occur at equal intervals but are not necessarily equal is IRR.

The relevant Excel function for "Returns the modified internal rate of return for a series of cash flows that occur at equal intervals but are not necessarily equal" is the MODIFIED INTERNAL RATE OF RETURN function, known as MIRR in Excel.
The relevant Excel function that returns the price per $100 face value of a coupon paying security at a specified yield is PRICE.
The relevant Excel function that returns the interest rate per period for a constant annuity is the RATE function.
The relevant Excel function for returning the internal rate of return for a series of cash flows that are not necessarily equal or periodic is the XIRR function.

The relevant Excel function for calculating the present value of a series of unequal future cash flows that occur at equal intervals starting one period in the future is the PV function with a set of cash flows discounted individually, or more commonly, the NPV (Net Present Value) function. The NPV function in Excel calculates the present value of a series of future cash flows (which can be unequal) occurring at regular intervals, starting one period in the future, by discounting them using a specified rate.

Therefore, the answer is: NPV function.
